sentences.english: I am certain, after 14 years of encounters with the Taliban, that they are not beyond redemption.
sentences.chinese: 遭遇塔利班14年，我知道他们并没有万劫不复。

sentences.english: The moment his fingers leave the leather loop of the handle, he will fall off the planet.
sentences.chinese: 他的手指一旦松开皮包拎手，就会坠落星球万劫不复。

sentences.english: Even the doomed eternally, I love you will never change until death.
sentences.chinese: 即使万劫不复，我亦爱你至死不渝。

sentences.english: Our youth in this rotten stinking struggling, and finally beyond redemption.
sentences.chinese: 我们在这个腐烂发臭的青春里挣扎，最后万劫不复。

sentences.english: The threat of criminal prosecution can doom a business.
sentences.chinese: 面临刑事立案的企业或将万劫不复。

sentences.english: See skulking Truth to her old cavern fled.
Finally let me in on that love is not allowed beyond redemption.
sentences.chinese: 最终让我在那不被允许的爱情里万劫不复。

sentences.english: Around six months later it started a perpetualdecline.
sentences.chinese: 大约六个月后，它开始了万劫不复的下坠。

definition: see 一著不慎，滿盤皆輸|一着不慎，满盘皆输[yi1 zhao1 bu4 shen4 , man3 pan2 jie1 shu1]
to lose one's standing/to have one's reputation swept away/a complete defeat and fall from grace

momentary slip/false step/ill-considered action
a single slip may cause everlasting sorrow (idiom)

definition: circumstances
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
critical circumstances/risky conditions/danger zone
to drop into/to fall into
(in such circumstances) there will be no peace/one can never breathe easy
to forfeit (future profit, one's life etc)/ruined
lit. the soul flies away and scatters (idiom)/fig. to be frightened stiff/spooked out of one's mind/terror-stricken
to sink into (vice, depravity etc)/to pass into oblivion/downfall/passing
dead end/(fig.) the road to disaster
to fall deeper and deeper (in debt, in love etc)
